how to install downloaded files in ubuntu
you know about install/remove and synaptic, right ?
you hardly ever need to download and install - the package manager does it for you
or open add/remove programs, search for kaffeine
it will ask for your user password when you click to install
Ubuntu uses sudo and has no root password by default - your first user's password is the sudo password
you use sudo or gksudo - read the url the bot sent you
it is done automatically by the package manager
as we said before , kaffeine is installed with the package manager
as are almost any apps you will need
so start with add/remove in the applications menu - search for your apps and click to install - that's about it really
and the password it will ask for is *your* password, not a root password
what are you running ? amd64 ? i686? ppc?
kaffeine is in the main repository, so it is there unles you have changed something
